author: wsjcom
title: Candy and SNAPs, Nanny or Nutritionalist?
text:
Maine Gov. Paul R. LePage’s “Get Food Stamps Out of the Candy Store” (op-ed, Jan. 24) leaves out important information for consideration as the conversation related to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) begins to unfold nationally.
Americans who are on SNAP (food stamps) and those who are not both consume chocolate and candy in a manner that fits with the recommendations in the federal government’s Dietary Guidelines for Americans, including the limits on added sugars. According to the most recent National...
